subject: Win One, Lose One
event:
A strong, convincing win by the Giants today.  Of course, it was against the Rams, and the Rams look truly pathetic so far this year.  But then again, I thought the Skins looked wretched last week against the G-Men and this week they managed to upset the Saints, one of the trendy picks for this year's NFC title... so maybe it's the Giants making these other teams look bad, at least in part.  Anyway, Eli Manning looked very sharp, the defense stuffed the run again and harassed the qb as if Strahan and Osi were still on the field (Justin Tuck looked awesome), and the three-headed running tandem of Jacobs, Ward, and Bradshaw is a real beast.  So it's 2-0, and next week the Bengals come to town.  So far, so good.

The Jets game, on the other hand... sigh....

Even without Brady, the Patriots still seem to have our number.  As Tom Jackson said in the postgame commentary on ESPN, "if not now, when?"  I have to wonder.  

I blame the playcalling, at least in part.  They're not letting Favre be Favre.  Too much playing close to the vest, playing not to lose.  Against the Patriots, you can't set up the pass by establishing a running game.  The Jets should know that by now.  Against the Patriots, you need to set up the running game with the pass, by stretching the field.  And they should have gone after Cassel much more aggressively.

It was especially disheartening watching Lamont Jordan gash the Jets with one strong run after another, exactly the way he used to gash other teams when he was Curtis Martin's backup on the Jets.  I always liked Lamont, and was sorry when the Jets lost him.  I hate to see him in a Patriots uniform.

So... win one, lose one.

And beyond the Jets and Giants, there were some incredible games in the NFL this weekend.  I've got to say, I'm glad I'm not a San Diego Chargers fan.  Losing is one thing.  Losing the way the Chargers lost these past two weeks would kill me.  I thought the end of the Panthers game was amazing, but the finish of the Broncos game... aaargh...

And next week the Jets have to go to San Diego, where the Chargers will either be (1) reeling or (2) really fired up.  Urk.

comments.article: I don't think you have anything to fear from the Chargers.  They're looking to start this year the same as they did last year...only without Merriman, Turner, Lorenzo Neal, and maybe L.T.  :/
The Giants looks like they could make a decent run at the NFC title this year the way they've been playing.
I have Cotchery on my fantasy football team.  Talk about disappointing.

your right what kind of offense were the jets running. but when they had to throw the ball in the 4th they got a touchdown, and just when momentum turned the defense couldn't make a stop or bring pressure after doing it most of the game.
Big Brett Favre fan and packers fan. did you see Aaron Rogers??!!!!!!!
we give up a hall of famer and still have a great quarter back(take that chicago)
comments.subject: NFL

comments.article:
I saw the end of the Jets and Patriots game. It was disheartening; I was hoping the Jets would pull it around there, but it felt like just when they got their act together, it was too late; they should have taken a bigger chance a lot quicker by getting some stronger passes in there.

I also felt like there was a disconnect between the other players and Favre; it seemed like he would pause and not be entirely certain for a couple seconds, like he is still learning where his fellow players will be and what they will do. It looked like he was a little confused out there.

I'm hoping they turn it around.
All is explained here.
comments.subject: Why the Giants Won

comments.article: How true. Reminds me of my brother's '86 Mets seat. From time to time I have to remind myself that the universe doesn't revolve around me (no matter what Joseph Campbell said). Now I have proof.
comments.subject: Re: Why the Giants Won

comments.article: Stupid Cardinals . . . :P That wasn't a good result for Miami. The defense was stumped by Arizona's passing game.

comments.upictitle: Ass McTavish and the land behind the Tavern: pic#5007096
comments.article: obviously not a personal slight to you, but i relished that beating.  2-0 for the first time since 1991?  stoked!
Favre dream?
comments.subject: blog

comments.article: Hee hee :)
comments.subject: Re: blog

comments.article: We Charger fans are used to it. After all, not only do San Diegans have the Chargers to help them get accustomed to losing, there's also the Padres. Plus the (non-existent) basketball team. When I moved to Manchester, UK, I found myself dispositionally hard-wired to be unable to support Manchester United! :-D

It's funny how the same thing can leave people feeling so differently...I personally am elated at the Patriots-Jets game! All those people who laughed at me last weekend and told me the Pats were gonna get stomped...it's NOT just Tom Brady that made my team great, and we're not gonna go down without a fight!

Congrats on the Giants win anyway. :)
Hey, someone with a professional football team should send one to Cincinnati...

As much as I'd like to think otherwise (because I'm an Eagles fan) I think the Rams really are that bad although, the 6 (I think it was 6) sacks by the Giants defense were impressive. Our offense did better against them so it should be a good game when our teams play in November.

I was really sorry to see the Pats win. Thought for sure the Jets would be able to beat them.
Yeah, they ARE that bad.  Most of St Louis will agree.

Tom brady was only able to do what tom brady does because of his team.

Just as Aaron Rodgers stepped into Favre's shoes in a great program and it continues to be great, Cassel is also stepping into a great team, where Favre, while admittedly great, is stepping into a team that has had problems.

The denver/san diego game... the ref's gave that game to denver. A possesion changing bad call that cannot be reviewed because of technical difficulties? I've never heard of THAT before. A fumble that was recovered by SD which WAS reviewed only since the ref was so hopped up and blew his whistle he wouldn't reverse the call on the field? because he'd blown his whistle? WTF...

Oh well, at least I have the rare oppurtunity of saying that my team won.
does a win against the rams even count as a win? that's like the yankees parading their win against the bad news bears.

As my username suggests, I'm a Broncos fan. And that was the best regular season game I've ever seen. I love Mike Shannahan. Go Broncos.

The Giants looked superb too, but the Rams look frankly terrifying...SIX interceptions for Bulger???

Not to argue, but I think it's a pretty foolish statement to say that Tom Brady has accomplished what he has just because he had the team to back him up.  Back in 2002 did Brady have the most talented team in the NFL?  No.  And what happened?  The Pats still won the Superbowl, and Brady led them there.  Yes, now the Patriots do have an incredibly talented team, but don't use that as a way to discredit Brady for being one of the best quarterbacks in the game today.  I doubt we're going to have any issues of the Pats running up the score this year.  Why?  Because they don't have Brady, plain and simple.  If anything, the Giants are going to be that team this year, especially if they keep playing the way they're playing right now and Eli keeps improving his game.  I can't wait to see how the Pats will do against a better team.  Cassel vs. Manning (Peyton) should be a fun one.
comments.subject: Why the hate?

comments.article:
I'm convinced the Chargers will be fired up. They started off slow last year and will probably be fuming over the way they got robbed. And that game was one of the most incredible endings I've witnessed.

As to Justin Tuck ...

I told my friends in the off-season that I had a feeling Tuck was even more talented than Umenyora(sp?) I'm starting to think I'm right. The real scary thing is that if he can stay healthy (other than missing his second year), I think he has a chance to better than Strahan. Imagine that. One of the best ever retires at a position where there's a premium, and his replacement turns out to be better. He still has a lot to prove before that argument holds weight, but Tuck is certainly developing faster than young Strahan did.

I didn't really understand what they were thinking. The Patriots secondary is questionable to say the least. They get good pressure on the QB so you can't really do those 80 yard plays but you can easily take them out between 20-30 yard throws. At which point they will either expose themselves to long plays or the run.

I watched it and seriously doubted that "Man-genius" epitaph that the Jets Head Coach had. To be honest If you could manage good blocking I don't think the Secondary can stand up to the long plays either. However, best of luck dealing with their pass rush.

During the game I was thinking that the Giants were looking good because the teams they're playing were horrid. Then the DC team disproved that opinion. I was extremely pleased with Eli. Not only has he shown his 'intangible' factor, but also sound QB play. I don't expect him to become Dan Marino or Joe Montana. However, my eyes have been opened and I can now see why Ernie picked him in the manner he did. Also, kudos to the staff and the team for helping him weather us fickle and overbearing NY fans and media.

I generally don't look at the Jets. Yesterday I did. Hmmmm. I guess you can say they aren't letting Brett be Brett but as I see it he's to old to be that Brett. Don't misunderstand. He's still an exceptional QB, but with this O line we can probably expect a lot of interceptions in the second half of games. Brett looked tired to me even if Phil Simms didn't think so. They would have had a better shot at the victory if they had even a mediocre performance by their special teams.

As for the Chargers... couldn't have happened to a more deserving owner and front staff. How could anyone be so daft as to firer a staff who won 13 games and hire a joke. That said, I feel for their fans.

This defense is absolutely MISERABLE right now under the direction of defensive coordinator Ted"no qb pressure"Cotrell. I mean yes, the loss of Shawne Merriman is a HUGE blow to our D, but the lack of ANY blitz packages from our linebackers or safeties, are giving opposing qbs enough time to cut our secondary to shreds. George, I'm sure you remember Ted Cotrell, the one whom Herm Edwards fired for being to soft.  Well I've seen enough.  Our  recently fearsome D has gone the way of the down pillow; all nice and cushy.  Ted you are a dolt!!!
comments.subject: We were robbed but...

comments.article:
The joke around here (Rams country) is that the Giants get 2 bi weeks. One actual, and the other when they play the Rams. LOL They are truly pathetic.

I'll just keep routing for Mizzou!
Wait until Oct 26, when the Giants have to come to Pittsburgh. If the Steelers keep playing the way they have been, they are going to be a major contender this year.

I care about what defense can the Lannisters mount against the coming tide of the North?
What can Tyrion do to save the day in his own special way.

These are the players that matter to me. That I want to hear about from you.

I'll read you next book because I'm on the hook story wise. Sorry.. I'll read the last half of your previous book because I am on the hook story wise.

But by god the first time you put a knights name and number on the back of a knights armor is when I stop reading anything you write.

Ok... that is an unfair statement. I have never read anything else you have written in a professional sense. And until you can finish the story I have picked up I do not care to.

I hope you have your plot line timelined out and done and you are filling the gaps with stuff that your readers enjoy. Because if you haven't even gotten that far we have issues boss.

Not that you care. I mean hey it is football season after all. Enjoy the games.
comments.subject: You know what defense I care about?

comments.article:
My god, you're right! Every waking moment should involve GRRM shackled to his computer, typing and editing away! Surely all of his interests also transfer directly to ASoIaF, so we'd better hope he doesn't suddenly gain interest in anime, because then everyone's hair will instantly become large and unwieldy! Because that's about as reasonable as fearing he will label knights as football players!

This is not a Song of Ice and Fire update wire. This is a notblog. GRRM's entire life isn't consumed by his job - that would be very sad for George indeed.
comments.subject: Re: You know what defense I care about?

comments.article: I thought they did a great job letting Favre be Favre when he tossed that interception.

I am a Chargers fan and I can't believe what I've seen the last two games! I believe in these guys and I think that they will come out of the gates next Monday and go on a tear throughout the rest of the season just beating everyone else to pieces. If you saw the game the Chargers offense has to listed in the top 3 of the league, but that defense.... phew! What the heck happened to their secondary?! I know Merriman is gone but Cromartie and company have a lot of fixing to get done and quick.
